. It is the county town of Anglesey and is in the center of the island with the coast in each direction around 7 miles.

The town offers a relaxed, quaint atmosphere where the Welsh language is often spoken.  Beaumaris does not have many package vacations so you can truly create your own personalized vacations like no other in the world, especially as a central point, where all beaches are accessible within a 20 minute drive. In the west of the town is a large secondary school, Ysgol Gyfun Llangefni (Llangefni Comprehensive School).

value: - best way to get around town and the island itself, when not on foot
- most attractions are outside the town, therefore alternative transport is needed.
- car services can be called for attractions that cannot be reached by the previous two forms of transportation.

Today, Llangefni offers vacationers shopping, catching a rugby match on one of the T.V.'s in one of the local pubs, go on a golf outting at one of the local courses, as well as just take sometime to relax.
Its attractions include the Oriel Ynys Môn Museum, which details the history of Anglesey and housing the art collection of Charles Tunnicliffe.
